10.3 Projection Perspective 325
Figure 10.6
Illustration of the
projection
approach: Find a
subspace (line) that
minimizes the
length of the
difference vector
between projected
(orange) and
original (blue) data.
Taking all digits “8” in the MNIST training data, we compute the eigen-
values of the data covariance matrix. Figure 10.5(a) shows the200 largest
eigenvalues of the data covariance matrix. We see that only a few of
them have a value that differs signiﬁcantly from 0. Therefore, most of
